intro: Hirtella glaberrima, commonly known as the rough hirtella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, oval leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a rough texture. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Hirtella glaberrima is typically found in humid, lowland forests and is adapted to thrive in warm, moist environments.
